reviews.text: Our booking was made through the tour group we were travelling with and we didn't know the name of the hotel prior to our arrival so I had no chance to research the property - not that research would have helped on this occasion as other reviews on Trip Advisor and information in the backpackers Lonely Planet rate this hotel as the best in Palenque. I do not understand why!! The staff seemed to be running around chaotically yet achieving very little - including in the bar and restaurant. After waiting for them to figure out which rooms had been assigned to the group we were then lead along poorly maintained (very poorly light at night) paths while they figured out exactly which rooms were available. Onced assigned to our room I was gob smacked, I walked in to graffitied and dirty walls, a fithly bed, a door that didn't lock properly and a bathroom that had little privacy!! I know this place is cheap and you get what you pay for, but honestly this place was down right disgusting! We were offered another room which was just as bad and you could also see where previous guests had used tape in an attempt to plug the holes in the fly screen to keep the bugs out!! There are also what appear to be stray dogs and cats all through the grounds of the hotel. It should be said that I am not a back packer and am used to decent, (clean and safe) mid-range accommodation - El Panchan is none of those things! My husband and I walked about 800m back towards Palanque and found our own accommodation, which still provide the stay in the jungle experience, as we both refused to stay there. We only returned to El Panchan to have dinner with the rest of the tour group on one occaision and to meet up with the group to depart for daily activities. There is a wide range of food at the restaurant, the meals are huge and are good quality, however, a little on the pricey side. If you are in Palanque to see the ruins El Panchan is located basically right outside the entrance to the park - other than the location and food I struggle to find anything positive to say about this property!
reviews.title: Seriously horrible!!!

reviews.text: We went to Palenque and decided to stay at the El Panchan resort (which is not such a resort you might know from beaches). It has three restaurants (the fourth one, a vegetarian place is closed unfortunately) and two or three different places to stay. Margarita&Ed are offering cabanas and private rooms, we stayed in one of the private rooms.
reviews.title: EL Panchon - Fantastico!

reviews.text: It is in the middle of the jungle so quite everything gets wet and is starting to molder within days. But this place is all clean, they have built houses with natural ventilation and change towels, linnen etc. daily to prevent this. The room is comfortable, the bed OK and most of all: The staff (and especially Margarita, the owner) are very friendly and helpful.

reviews.text: The town of Palenque itself does not have much to offer and El Panchan gives you a lovely retreat in the jungle where you can fall asleep listening to the sounds of the jungle creatures and be just minutes from the Palenque ruins by jumping on the "collectivo" buses that come past every 10 minutes for just $2 per person.

reviews.text: I had a wonderful 2-night stay in a cabana at El Panchan in the Chanto's Cabanas section. I found the accommodations clean, with seemingly unlimited hot water in an unmatched setting -- the middle of the jungle just down the road from the ruins. It was a 10 peso collectivo ride into ruins or to town (a few miles away).

reviews.title: Beautiful rainforrest
reviews.text: This is absolutely paradise. We stayed in El Panchan for five days and it's great because on one hand there's a cabin with 360 degrees view of beautiful rainforrest; on the other hand there is a very good restaurant with life music every night and with a very nice 'jungle' atmosphere. The pizza's from the woodoven are fantastic.
Also, the accomodation is very cheap!
